1309  /**
1310   * Structure step that will read the section.xml creating/updating sections
1311   * as needed, rebuilding course cache and other friends
1312   */
1313  class restore_section_structure_step extends restore_structure_step {
1314  
1315      protected function define_structure() {
1316          global $CFG;
1317  
1318          $paths = array();
1319  
1320          $section = new restore_path_element('section', '/section');
1321          $paths[] = $section;
1322          if ($CFG->enableavailability) {
1323              $paths[] = new restore_path_element('availability', '/section/availability');
1324              $paths[] = new restore_path_element('availability_field', '/section/availability_field');
1325          }
1326          $paths[] = new restore_path_element('course_format_options', '/section/course_format_options');
1327  
1328          // Apply for 'format' plugins optional paths at section level
1329          $this->add_plugin_structure('format', $section);
1330  
1331          // Apply for 'local' plugins optional paths at section level
1332          $this->add_plugin_structure('local', $section);
1333  
1334          return $paths;
1335      }
1336  
1337      public function process_section($data) {
1338          global $CFG, $DB;
1339          $data = (object)$data;
1340          $oldid = $data->id; // We'll need this later
1341  
1342          $restorefiles = false;
1343  
1344          // Look for the section
1345          $section = new stdclass();
1346          $section->course  = $this->get_courseid();
1347          $section->section = $data->number;
1348          // Section doesn't exist, create it with all the info from backup
1349          if (!$secrec = $DB->get_record('course_sections', (array)$section)) {
1350              $section->name = $data->name;
1351              $section->summary = $data->summary;
1352              $section->summaryformat = $data->summaryformat;
1353              $section->sequence = '';
1354              $section->visible = $data->visible;
1355              if (empty($CFG->enableavailability)) { // Process availability information only if enabled.
1356                  $section->availability = null;
1357              } else {
1358                  $section->availability = isset($data->availabilityjson) ? $data->availabilityjson : null;
1359                  // Include legacy [<2.7] availability data if provided.
1360                  if (is_null($section->availability)) {
1361                      $section->availability = \core_availability\info::convert_legacy_fields(
1362                              $data, true);
1363                  }
1364              }
1365              $newitemid = $DB->insert_record('course_sections', $section);
1366              $restorefiles = true;
1367  
1368          // Section exists, update non-empty information
1369          } else {
1370              $section->id = $secrec->id;
1371              if ((string)$secrec->name === '') {
1372                  $section->name = $data->name;
1373              }
1374              if (empty($secrec->summary)) {
1375                  $section->summary = $data->summary;
1376                  $section->summaryformat = $data->summaryformat;
1377                  $restorefiles = true;
1378              }
1379  
1380              // Don't update availability (I didn't see a useful way to define
1381              // whether existing or new one should take precedence).
1382  
1383              $DB->update_record('course_sections', $section);
1384              $newitemid = $secrec->id;
1385          }
1386  
1387          // Annotate the section mapping, with restorefiles option if needed
1388          $this->set_mapping('course_section', $oldid, $newitemid, $restorefiles);
1389  
1390          // set the new course_section id in the task
1391          $this->task->set_sectionid($newitemid);
1392  
1393          // If there is the legacy showavailability data, store this for later use.
1394          // (This data is not present when restoring 'new' backups.)
1395          if (isset($data->showavailability)) {
1396              // Cache the showavailability flag using the backup_ids data field.
1397              restore_dbops::set_backup_ids_record($this->get_restoreid(),
1398                      'section_showavailability', $newitemid, 0, null,
1399                      (object)array('showavailability' => $data->showavailability));
1400          }
1401  
1402          // Commented out. We never modify course->numsections as far as that is used
1403          // by a lot of people to "hide" sections on purpose (so this remains as used to be in Moodle 1.x)
1404          // Note: We keep the code here, to know about and because of the possibility of making this
1405          // optional based on some setting/attribute in the future
1406          // If needed, adjust course->numsections
1407          //if ($numsections = $DB->get_field('course', 'numsections', array('id' => $this->get_courseid()))) {
1408          //    if ($numsections < $section->section) {
1409          //        $DB->set_field('course', 'numsections', $section->section, array('id' => $this->get_courseid()));
1410          //    }
1411          //}
1412      }
1413  
1414      /**
1415       * Process the legacy availability table record. This table does not exist
1416       * in Moodle 2.7+ but we still support restore.
1417       *
1418       * @param stdClass $data Record data
1419       */
1420      public function process_availability($data) {
1421          $data = (object)$data;
1422          // Simply going to store the whole availability record now, we'll process
1423          // all them later in the final task (once all activities have been restored)
1424          // Let's call the low level one to be able to store the whole object.
1425          $data->coursesectionid = $this->task->get_sectionid();
1426          restore_dbops::set_backup_ids_record($this->get_restoreid(),
1427                  'section_availability', $data->id, 0, null, $data);
1428      }
1429  
1430      /**
1431       * Process the legacy availability fields table record. This table does not
1432       * exist in Moodle 2.7+ but we still support restore.
1433       *
1434       * @param stdClass $data Record data
1435       */
1436      public function process_availability_field($data) {
1437          global $DB;
1438          $data = (object)$data;
1439          // Mark it is as passed by default
1440          $passed = true;
1441          $customfieldid = null;
1442  
1443          // If a customfield has been used in order to pass we must be able to match an existing
1444          // customfield by name (data->customfield) and type (data->customfieldtype)
1445          if (is_null($data->customfield) xor is_null($data->customfieldtype)) {
1446              // xor is sort of uncommon. If either customfield is null or customfieldtype is null BUT not both.
1447              // If one is null but the other isn't something clearly went wrong and we'll skip this condition.
1448              $passed = false;
1449          } else if (!is_null($data->customfield)) {
1450              $params = array('shortname' => $data->customfield, 'datatype' => $data->customfieldtype);
1451              $customfieldid = $DB->get_field('user_info_field', 'id', $params);
1452              $passed = ($customfieldid !== false);
1453          }
1454  
1455          if ($passed) {
1456              // Create the object to insert into the database
1457              $availfield = new stdClass();
1458              $availfield->coursesectionid = $this->task->get_sectionid();
1459              $availfield->userfield = $data->userfield;
1460              $availfield->customfieldid = $customfieldid;
1461              $availfield->operator = $data->operator;
1462              $availfield->value = $data->value;
1463  
1464              // Get showavailability option.
1465              $showrec = restore_dbops::get_backup_ids_record($this->get_restoreid(),
1466                      'section_showavailability', $availfield->coursesectionid);
1467              if (!$showrec) {
1468                  // Should not happen.
1469                  throw new coding_exception('No matching showavailability record');
1470              }
1471              $show = $showrec->info->showavailability;
1472  
1473              // The $availfield object is now in the format used in the old
1474              // system. Interpret this and convert to new system.
1475              $currentvalue = $DB->get_field('course_sections', 'availability',
1476                      array('id' => $availfield->coursesectionid), MUST_EXIST);
1477              $newvalue = \core_availability\info::add_legacy_availability_field_condition(
1478                      $currentvalue, $availfield, $show);
1479              $DB->set_field('course_sections', 'availability', $newvalue,
1480                      array('id' => $availfield->coursesectionid));
1481          }
1482      }
1483  
1484      public function process_course_format_options($data) {
1485          global $DB;
1486          static $courseformats = array();
1487          $courseid = $this->get_courseid();
1488          if (!array_key_exists($courseid, $courseformats)) {
1489              // It is safe to have a static cache of course formats because format can not be changed after this point.
1490              $courseformats[$courseid] = $DB->get_field('course', 'format', array('id' => $courseid));
1491          }
1492          $data = (array)$data;
1493          if ($courseformats[$courseid] === $data['format']) {
1494              // Import section format options only if both courses (the one that was backed up
1495              // and the one we are restoring into) have same formats.
1496              $params = array(
1497                  'courseid' => $this->get_courseid(),
1498                  'sectionid' => $this->task->get_sectionid(),
1499                  'format' => $data['format'],
1500                  'name' => $data['name']
1501              );
1502              if ($record = $DB->get_record('course_format_options', $params, 'id, value')) {
1503                  // Do not overwrite existing information.
1504                  $newid = $record->id;
1505              } else {
1506                  $params['value'] = $data['value'];
1507                  $newid = $DB->insert_record('course_format_options', $params);
1508              }
1509              $this->set_mapping('course_format_options', $data['id'], $newid);
1510          }
1511      }
1512  
1513      protected function after_execute() {
1514          // Add section related files, with 'course_section' itemid to match
1515          $this->add_related_files('course', 'section', 'course_section');
1516      }
1517  }
1518  
1519  /**
1520   * Structure step that will read the course.xml file, loading it and performing
1521   * various actions depending of the site/restore settings. Note that target
1522   * course always exist before arriving here so this step will be updating
1523   * the course record (never inserting)
1524   */
1525  class restore_course_structure_step extends restore_structure_step {
1526      /**
1527       * @var bool this gets set to true by {@link process_course()} if we are
1528       * restoring an old coures that used the legacy 'module security' feature.
1529       * If so, we have to do more work in {@link after_execute()}.
1530       */
1531      protected $legacyrestrictmodules = false;
1532  
1533      /**
1534       * @var array Used when {@link $legacyrestrictmodules} is true. This is an
1535       * array with array keys the module names ('forum', 'quiz', etc.). These are
1536       * the modules that are allowed according to the data in the backup file.
1537       * In {@link after_execute()} we then have to prevent adding of all the other
1538       * types of activity.
1539       */
1540      protected $legacyallowedmodules = array();
1541  
1542      protected function define_structure() {
1543  
1544          $course = new restore_path_element('course', '/course');
1545          $category = new restore_path_element('category', '/course/category');
1546          $tag = new restore_path_element('tag', '/course/tags/tag');
1547          $allowed_module = new restore_path_element('allowed_module', '/course/allowed_modules/module');
1548  
1549          // Apply for 'format' plugins optional paths at course level
1550          $this->add_plugin_structure('format', $course);
1551  
1552          // Apply for 'theme' plugins optional paths at course level
1553          $this->add_plugin_structure('theme', $course);
1554  
1555          // Apply for 'report' plugins optional paths at course level
1556          $this->add_plugin_structure('report', $course);
1557  
1558          // Apply for 'course report' plugins optional paths at course level
1559          $this->add_plugin_structure('coursereport', $course);
1560  
1561          // Apply for plagiarism plugins optional paths at course level
1562          $this->add_plugin_structure('plagiarism', $course);
1563  
1564          // Apply for local plugins optional paths at course level
1565          $this->add_plugin_structure('local', $course);
1566  
1567          return array($course, $category, $tag, $allowed_module);
1568      }
1569  
1570      /**
1571       * Processing functions go here
1572       *
1573       * @global moodledatabase $DB
1574       * @param stdClass $data
1575       */
1576      public function process_course($data) {
1577          global $CFG, $DB;
1578  
1579          $data = (object)$data;
1580  
1581          $fullname  = $this->get_setting_value('course_fullname');
1582          $shortname = $this->get_setting_value('course_shortname');
1583          $startdate = $this->get_setting_value('course_startdate');
1584  
1585          // Calculate final course names, to avoid dupes
1586          list($fullname, $shortname) = restore_dbops::calculate_course_names($this->get_courseid(), $fullname, $shortname);
1587  
1588          // Need to change some fields before updating the course record
1589          $data->id = $this->get_courseid();
1590          $data->fullname = $fullname;
1591          $data->shortname= $shortname;
1592  
1593          // Only allow the idnumber to be set if the user has permission and the idnumber is not already in use by
1594          // another course on this site.
1595          $context = context::instance_by_id($this->task->get_contextid());
1596          if (!empty($data->idnumber) && has_capability('moodle/course:changeidnumber', $context, $this->task->get_userid()) &&
1597                  $this->task->is_samesite() && !$DB->record_exists('course', array('idnumber' => $data->idnumber))) {
1598              // Do not reset idnumber.
1599          } else {
1600              $data->idnumber = '';
1601          }
1602  
1603          // Any empty value for course->hiddensections will lead to 0 (default, show collapsed).
1604          // It has been reported that some old 1.9 courses may have it null leading to DB error. MDL-31532
1605          if (empty($data->hiddensections)) {
1606              $data->hiddensections = 0;
1607          }
1608  
1609          // Set legacyrestrictmodules to true if the course was resticting modules. If so
1610          // then we will need to process restricted modules after execution.
1611          $this->legacyrestrictmodules = !empty($data->restrictmodules);
1612  
1613          $data->startdate= $this->apply_date_offset($data->startdate);
1614          if ($data->defaultgroupingid) {
1615              $data->defaultgroupingid = $this->get_mappingid('grouping', $data->defaultgroupingid);
1616          }
1617          if (empty($CFG->enablecompletion)) {
1618              $data->enablecompletion = 0;
1619              $data->completionstartonenrol = 0;
1620              $data->completionnotify = 0;
1621          }
1622          $languages = get_string_manager()->get_list_of_translations(); // Get languages for quick search
1623          if (!array_key_exists($data->lang, $languages)) {
1624              $data->lang = '';
1625          }
1626  
1627          $themes = get_list_of_themes(); // Get themes for quick search later
1628          if (!array_key_exists($data->theme, $themes) || empty($CFG->allowcoursethemes)) {
1629              $data->theme = '';
1630          }
1631  
1632          // Check if this is an old SCORM course format.
1633          if ($data->format == 'scorm') {
1634              $data->format = 'singleactivity';
1635              $data->activitytype = 'scorm';
1636          }
1637  
1638          // Course record ready, update it
1639          $DB->update_record('course', $data);
1640  
1641          course_get_format($data)->update_course_format_options($data);
1642  
1643          // Role name aliases
1644          restore_dbops::set_course_role_names($this->get_restoreid(), $this->get_courseid());
1645      }
1646  
1647      public function process_category($data) {
1648          // Nothing to do with the category. UI sets it before restore starts
1649      }
1650  
1651      public function process_tag($data) {
1652          global $CFG, $DB;
1653  
1654          $data = (object)$data;
1655  
1656          if (!empty($CFG->usetags)) { // if enabled in server
1657              // TODO: This is highly inneficient. Each time we add one tag
1658              // we fetch all the existing because tag_set() deletes them
1659              // so everything must be reinserted on each call
1660              $tags = array();
1661              $existingtags = tag_get_tags('course', $this->get_courseid());
1662              // Re-add all the existitng tags
1663              foreach ($existingtags as $existingtag) {
1664                  $tags[] = $existingtag->rawname;
1665              }
1666              // Add the one being restored
1667              $tags[] = $data->rawname;
1668              // Send all the tags back to the course
1669              tag_set('course', $this->get_courseid(), $tags, 'core',
1670                  context_course::instance($this->get_courseid())->id);
1671          }
1672      }
1673  
1674      public function process_allowed_module($data) {
1675          $data = (object)$data;
1676  
1677          // Backwards compatiblity support for the data that used to be in the
1678          // course_allowed_modules table.
1679          if ($this->legacyrestrictmodules) {
1680              $this->legacyallowedmodules[$data->modulename] = 1;
1681          }
1682      }
1683  
1684      protected function after_execute() {
1685          global $DB;
1686  
1687          // Add course related files, without itemid to match
1688          $this->add_related_files('course', 'summary', null);
1689          $this->add_related_files('course', 'overviewfiles', null);
1690  
1691          // Deal with legacy allowed modules.
1692          if ($this->legacyrestrictmodules) {
1693              $context = context_course::instance($this->get_courseid());
1694  
1695              list($roleids) = get_roles_with_cap_in_context($context, 'moodle/course:manageactivities');
1696              list($managerroleids) = get_roles_with_cap_in_context($context, 'moodle/site:config');
1697              foreach ($managerroleids as $roleid) {
1698                  unset($roleids[$roleid]);
1699              }
1700  
1701              foreach (core_component::get_plugin_list('mod') as $modname => $notused) {
1702                  if (isset($this->legacyallowedmodules[$modname])) {
1703                      // Module is allowed, no worries.
1704                      continue;
1705                  }
1706  
1707                  $capability = 'mod/' . $modname . ':addinstance';
1708                  foreach ($roleids as $roleid) {
1709                      assign_capability($capability, CAP_PREVENT, $roleid, $context);
1710                  }
1711              }
1712          }
1713      }
1714  }
1715  
1716  /**
1717   * Execution step that will migrate legacy files if present.
1718   */
1719  class restore_course_legacy_files_step extends restore_execution_step {
1720      public function define_execution() {
1721          global $DB;
1722  
1723          // Do a check for legacy files and skip if there are none.
1724          $sql = 'SELECT count(*)
1725                    FROM {backup_files_temp}
1726                   WHERE backupid = ?
1727                     AND contextid = ?
1728                     AND component = ?
1729                     AND filearea  = ?';
1730          $params = array($this->get_restoreid(), $this->task->get_old_contextid(), 'course', 'legacy');
1731  
1732          if ($DB->count_records_sql($sql, $params)) {
1733              $DB->set_field('course', 'legacyfiles', 2, array('id' => $this->get_courseid()));
1734              restore_dbops::send_files_to_pool($this->get_basepath(), $this->get_restoreid(), 'course',
1735                  'legacy', $this->task->get_old_contextid(), $this->task->get_userid());
1736          }
1737      }
1738  }
1739  
1740  /*
1741   * Structure step that will read the roles.xml file (at course/activity/block levels)
1742   * containing all the role_assignments and overrides for that context. If corresponding to
1743   * one mapped role, they will be applied to target context. Will observe the role_assignments
1744   * setting to decide if ras are restored.
1745   *
1746   * Note: this needs to be executed after all users are enrolled.
1747   */
1748  class restore_ras_and_caps_structure_step extends restore_structure_step {
1749      protected $plugins = null;
1750  
1751      protected function define_structure() {
1752  
1753          $paths = array();
1754  
1755          // Observe the role_assignments setting
1756          if ($this->get_setting_value('role_assignments')) {
1757              $paths[] = new restore_path_element('assignment', '/roles/role_assignments/assignment');
1758          }
1759          $paths[] = new restore_path_element('override', '/roles/role_overrides/override');
1760  
1761          return $paths;
1762      }
1763  
1764      /**
1765       * Assign roles
1766       *
1767       * This has to be called after enrolments processing.
1768       *
1769       * @param mixed $data
1770       * @return void
1771       */
1772      public function process_assignment($data) {
1773          global $DB;
1774  
1775          $data = (object)$data;
1776  
1777          // Check roleid, userid are one of the mapped ones
1778          if (!$newroleid = $this->get_mappingid('role', $data->roleid)) {
1779              return;
1780          }
1781          if (!$newuserid = $this->get_mappingid('user', $data->userid)) {
1782              return;
1783          }
1784          if (!$DB->record_exists('user', array('id' => $newuserid, 'deleted' => 0))) {
1785              // Only assign roles to not deleted users
1786              return;
1787          }
1788          if (!$contextid = $this->task->get_contextid()) {
1789              return;
1790          }
1791  
1792          if (empty($data->component)) {
1793              // assign standard manual roles
1794              // TODO: role_assign() needs one userid param to be able to specify our restore userid
1795              role_assign($newroleid, $newuserid, $contextid);
1796  
1797          } else if ((strpos($data->component, 'enrol_') === 0)) {
1798              // Deal with enrolment roles - ignore the component and just find out the instance via new id,
1799              // it is possible that enrolment was restored using different plugin type.
1800              if (!isset($this->plugins)) {
1801                  $this->plugins = enrol_get_plugins(true);
1802              }
1803              if ($enrolid = $this->get_mappingid('enrol', $data->itemid)) {
1804                  if ($instance = $DB->get_record('enrol', array('id'=>$enrolid))) {
1805                      if (isset($this->plugins[$instance->enrol])) {
1806                          $this->plugins[$instance->enrol]->restore_role_assignment($instance, $newroleid, $newuserid, $contextid);
1807                      }
1808                  }
1809              }
1810  
1811          } else {
1812              $data->roleid    = $newroleid;
1813              $data->userid    = $newuserid;
1814              $data->contextid = $contextid;
1815              $dir = core_component::get_component_directory($data->component);
1816              if ($dir and is_dir($dir)) {
1817                  if (component_callback($data->component, 'restore_role_assignment', array($this, $data), true)) {
1818                      return;
1819                  }
1820              }
1821              // Bad luck, plugin could not restore the data, let's add normal membership.
1822              role_assign($data->roleid, $data->userid, $data->contextid);
1823              $message = "Restore of '$data->component/$data->itemid' role assignments is not supported, using manual role assignments instead.";
1824              $this->log($message, backup::LOG_WARNING);
1825          }
1826      }
1827  
1828      public function process_override($data) {
1829          $data = (object)$data;
1830  
1831          // Check roleid is one of the mapped ones
1832          $newroleid = $this->get_mappingid('role', $data->roleid);
1833          // If newroleid and context are valid assign it via API (it handles dupes and so on)
1834          if ($newroleid && $this->task->get_contextid()) {
1835              // TODO: assign_capability() needs one userid param to be able to specify our restore userid
1836              // TODO: it seems that assign_capability() doesn't check for valid capabilities at all ???
1837              assign_capability($data->capability, $data->permission, $newroleid, $this->task->get_contextid());
1838          }
1839      }
1840  }

1842  /**
1843   * If no instances yet add default enrol methods the same way as when creating new course in UI.
1844   */
1845  class restore_default_enrolments_step extends restore_execution_step {
1846  
1847      public function define_execution() {
1848          global $DB;
1849  
1850          // No enrolments in front page.
1851          if ($this->get_courseid() == SITEID) {
1852              return;
1853          }
1854  
1855          $course = $DB->get_record('course', array('id'=>$this->get_courseid()), '*', MUST_EXIST);
1856  
1857          if ($DB->record_exists('enrol', array('courseid'=>$this->get_courseid(), 'enrol'=>'manual'))) {
1858              // Something already added instances, do not add default instances.
1859              $plugins = enrol_get_plugins(true);
1860              foreach ($plugins as $plugin) {
1861                  $plugin->restore_sync_course($course);
1862              }
1863  
1864          } else {
1865              // Looks like a newly created course.
1866              enrol_course_updated(true, $course, null);
1867          }
1868      }
1869  }

1871  /**
1872   * This structure steps restores the enrol plugins and their underlying
1873   * enrolments, performing all the mappings and/or movements required
1874   */
1875  class restore_enrolments_structure_step extends restore_structure_step {
1876      protected $enrolsynced = false;
1877      protected $plugins = null;
1878      protected $originalstatus = array();
1879  
1880      /**
1881       * Conditionally decide if this step should be executed.
1882       *
1883       * This function checks the following parameter:
1884       *
1885       *   1. the course/enrolments.xml file exists
1886       *
1887       * @return bool true is safe to execute, false otherwise
1888       */
1889      protected function execute_condition() {
1890  
1891          if ($this->get_courseid() == SITEID) {
1892              return false;
1893          }
1894  
1895          // Check it is included in the backup
1896          $fullpath = $this->task->get_taskbasepath();
1897          $fullpath = rtrim($fullpath, '/') . '/' . $this->filename;
1898          if (!file_exists($fullpath)) {
1899              // Not found, can't restore enrolments info
1900              return false;
1901          }
1902  
1903          return true;
1904      }
1905  
1906      protected function define_structure() {
1907  
1908          $enrol = new restore_path_element('enrol', '/enrolments/enrols/enrol');
1909          $enrolment = new restore_path_element('enrolment', '/enrolments/enrols/enrol/user_enrolments/enrolment');
1910          // Attach local plugin stucture to enrol element.
1911          $this->add_plugin_structure('enrol', $enrol);
1912  
1913          return array($enrol, $enrolment);
1914      }
1915  
1916      /**
1917       * Create enrolment instances.
1918       *
1919       * This has to be called after creation of roles
1920       * and before adding of role assignments.
1921       *
1922       * @param mixed $data
1923       * @return void
1924       */
1925      public function process_enrol($data) {
1926          global $DB;
1927  
1928          $data = (object)$data;
1929          $oldid = $data->id; // We'll need this later.
1930          unset($data->id);
1931  
1932          $this->originalstatus[$oldid] = $data->status;
1933  
1934          if (!$courserec = $DB->get_record('course', array('id' => $this->get_courseid()))) {
1935              $this->set_mapping('enrol', $oldid, 0);
1936              return;
1937          }
1938  
1939          if (!isset($this->plugins)) {
1940              $this->plugins = enrol_get_plugins(true);
1941          }
1942  
1943          if (!$this->enrolsynced) {
1944              // Make sure that all plugin may create instances and enrolments automatically
1945              // before the first instance restore - this is suitable especially for plugins
1946              // that synchronise data automatically using course->idnumber or by course categories.
1947              foreach ($this->plugins as $plugin) {
1948                  $plugin->restore_sync_course($courserec);
1949              }
1950              $this->enrolsynced = true;
1951          }
1952  
1953          // Map standard fields - plugin has to process custom fields manually.
1954          $data->roleid   = $this->get_mappingid('role', $data->roleid);
1955          $data->courseid = $courserec->id;
1956  
1957          if ($this->get_setting_value('enrol_migratetomanual')) {
1958              unset($data->sortorder); // Remove useless sortorder from <2.4 backups.
1959              if (!enrol_is_enabled('manual')) {
1960                  $this->set_mapping('enrol', $oldid, 0);
1961                  return;
1962              }
1963              if ($instances = $DB->get_records('enrol', array('courseid'=>$data->courseid, 'enrol'=>'manual'), 'id')) {
1964                  $instance = reset($instances);
1965                  $this->set_mapping('enrol', $oldid, $instance->id);
1966              } else {
1967                  if ($data->enrol === 'manual') {
1968                      $instanceid = $this->plugins['manual']->add_instance($courserec, (array)$data);
1969                  } else {
1970                      $instanceid = $this->plugins['manual']->add_default_instance($courserec);
1971                  }
1972                  $this->set_mapping('enrol', $oldid, $instanceid);
1973              }
1974  
1975          } else {
1976              if (!enrol_is_enabled($data->enrol) or !isset($this->plugins[$data->enrol])) {
1977                  $this->set_mapping('enrol', $oldid, 0);
1978                  $message = "Enrol plugin '$data->enrol' data can not be restored because it is not enabled, use migration to manual enrolments";
1979                  $this->log($message, backup::LOG_WARNING);
1980                  return;
1981              }
1982              if ($task = $this->get_task() and $task->get_target() == backup::TARGET_NEW_COURSE) {
1983                  // Let's keep the sortorder in old backups.
1984              } else {
1985                  // Prevent problems with colliding sortorders in old backups,
1986                  // new 2.4 backups do not need sortorder because xml elements are ordered properly.
1987                  unset($data->sortorder);
1988              }
1989              // Note: plugin is responsible for setting up the mapping, it may also decide to migrate to different type.
1990              $this->plugins[$data->enrol]->restore_instance($this, $data, $courserec, $oldid);
1991          }
1992      }
1993  
1994      /**
1995       * Create user enrolments.
1996       *
1997       * This has to be called after creation of enrolment instances
1998       * and before adding of role assignments.
1999       *
2000       * Roles are assigned in restore_ras_and_caps_structure_step::process_assignment() processing afterwards.
2001       *
2002       * @param mixed $data
2003       * @return void
2004       */
2005      public function process_enrolment($data) {
2006          global $DB;
2007  
2008          if (!isset($this->plugins)) {
2009              $this->plugins = enrol_get_plugins(true);
2010          }
2011  
2012          $data = (object)$data;
2013  
2014          // Process only if parent instance have been mapped.
2015          if ($enrolid = $this->get_new_parentid('enrol')) {
2016              $oldinstancestatus = ENROL_INSTANCE_ENABLED;
2017              $oldenrolid = $this->get_old_parentid('enrol');
2018              if (isset($this->originalstatus[$oldenrolid])) {
2019                  $oldinstancestatus = $this->originalstatus[$oldenrolid];
2020              }
2021              if ($instance = $DB->get_record('enrol', array('id'=>$enrolid))) {
2022                  // And only if user is a mapped one.
2023                  if ($userid = $this->get_mappingid('user', $data->userid)) {
2024                      if (isset($this->plugins[$instance->enrol])) {
2025                          $this->plugins[$instance->enrol]->restore_user_enrolment($this, $data, $instance, $userid, $oldinstancestatus);
2026                      }
2027                  }
2028              }
2029          }
2030      }
2031  }

2034  /**
2035   * Make sure the user restoring the course can actually access it.
2036   */
2037  class restore_fix_restorer_access_step extends restore_execution_step {
2038      protected function define_execution() {
2039          global $CFG, $DB;
2040  
2041          if (!$userid = $this->task->get_userid()) {
2042              return;
2043          }
2044  
2045          if (empty($CFG->restorernewroleid)) {
2046              // Bad luck, no fallback role for restorers specified
2047              return;
2048          }
2049  
2050          $courseid = $this->get_courseid();
2051          $context = context_course::instance($courseid);
2052  
2053          if (is_enrolled($context, $userid, 'moodle/course:update', true) or is_viewing($context, $userid, 'moodle/course:update')) {
2054              // Current user may access the course (admin, category manager or restored teacher enrolment usually)
2055              return;
2056          }
2057  
2058          // Try to add role only - we do not need enrolment if user has moodle/course:view or is already enrolled
2059          role_assign($CFG->restorernewroleid, $userid, $context);
2060  
2061          if (is_enrolled($context, $userid, 'moodle/course:update', true) or is_viewing($context, $userid, 'moodle/course:update')) {
2062              // Extra role is enough, yay!
2063              return;
2064          }
2065  
2066          // The last chance is to create manual enrol if it does not exist and and try to enrol the current user,
2067          // hopefully admin selected suitable $CFG->restorernewroleid ...
2068          if (!enrol_is_enabled('manual')) {
2069              return;
2070          }
2071          if (!$enrol = enrol_get_plugin('manual')) {
2072              return;
2073          }
2074          if (!$DB->record_exists('enrol', array('enrol'=>'manual', 'courseid'=>$courseid))) {
2075              $course = $DB->get_record('course', array('id'=>$courseid), '*', MUST_EXIST);
2076              $fields = array('status'=>ENROL_INSTANCE_ENABLED, 'enrolperiod'=>$enrol->get_config('enrolperiod', 0), 'roleid'=>$enrol->get_config('roleid', 0));
2077              $enrol->add_instance($course, $fields);
2078          }
2079  
2080          enrol_try_internal_enrol($courseid, $userid);
2081      }
2082  }

2143  class restore_comments_structure_step extends restore_structure_step {

2154      public function process_comment($data) {
2155          global $DB;
2156  
2157          $data = (object)$data;
2158  
2159          // First of all, if the comment has some itemid, ask to the task what to map
2160          $mapping = false;
2161          if ($data->itemid) {
2162              $mapping = $this->task->get_comment_mapping_itemname($data->commentarea);
2163              $data->itemid = $this->get_mappingid($mapping, $data->itemid);
2164          }
2165          // Only restore the comment if has no mapping OR we have found the matching mapping
2166          if (!$mapping || $data->itemid) {
2167              // Only if user mapping and context
2168              $data->userid = $this->get_mappingid('user', $data->userid);
2169              if ($data->userid && $this->task->get_contextid()) {
2170                  $data->contextid = $this->task->get_contextid();
2171                  // Only if there is another comment with same context/user/timecreated
2172                  $params = array('contextid' => $data->contextid, 'userid' => $data->userid, 'timecreated' => $data->timecreated);
2173                  if (!$DB->record_exists('comments', $params)) {
2174                      $DB->insert_record('comments', $data);
2175                  }
2176              }
2177          }
2178      }

2181  /**
2182   * This structure steps restores the badges and their configs
2183   */
2184  class restore_badges_structure_step extends restore_structure_step {
2185  
2186      /**
2187       * Conditionally decide if this step should be executed.
2188       *
2189       * This function checks the following parameters:
2190       *
2191       *   1. Badges and course badges are enabled on the site.
2192       *   2. The course/badges.xml file exists.
2193       *   3. All modules are restorable.
2194       *   4. All modules are marked for restore.
2195       *
2196       * @return bool True is safe to execute, false otherwise
2197       */
2198      protected function execute_condition() {
2199          global $CFG;
2200  
2201          // First check is badges and course level badges are enabled on this site.
2202          if (empty($CFG->enablebadges) || empty($CFG->badges_allowcoursebadges)) {
2203              // Disabled, don't restore course badges.
2204              return false;
2205          }
2206  
2207          // Check if badges.xml is included in the backup.
2208          $fullpath = $this->task->get_taskbasepath();
2209          $fullpath = rtrim($fullpath, '/') . '/' . $this->filename;
2210          if (!file_exists($fullpath)) {
2211              // Not found, can't restore course badges.
2212              return false;
2213          }
2214  
2215          // Check we are able to restore all backed up modules.
2216          if ($this->task->is_missing_modules()) {
2217              return false;
2218          }
2219  
2220          // Finally check all modules within the backup are being restored.
2221          if ($this->task->is_excluding_activities()) {
2222              return false;
2223          }
2224  
2225          return true;
2226      }
2227  
2228      protected function define_structure() {
2229          $paths = array();
2230          $paths[] = new restore_path_element('badge', '/badges/badge');
2231          $paths[] = new restore_path_element('criterion', '/badges/badge/criteria/criterion');
2232          $paths[] = new restore_path_element('parameter', '/badges/badge/criteria/criterion/parameters/parameter');
2233          $paths[] = new restore_path_element('manual_award', '/badges/badge/manual_awards/manual_award');
2234  
2235          return $paths;
2236      }
2237  
2238      public function process_badge($data) {
2239          global $DB, $CFG;
2240  
2241          require_once($CFG->libdir . '/badgeslib.php');
2242  
2243          $data = (object)$data;
2244          $data->usercreated = $this->get_mappingid('user', $data->usercreated);
2245          if (empty($data->usercreated)) {
2246              $data->usercreated = $this->task->get_userid();
2247          }
2248          $data->usermodified = $this->get_mappingid('user', $data->usermodified);
2249          if (empty($data->usermodified)) {
2250              $data->usermodified = $this->task->get_userid();
2251          }
2252  
2253          // We'll restore the badge image.
2254          $restorefiles = true;
2255  
2256          $courseid = $this->get_courseid();
2257  
2258          $params = array(
2259                  'name'           => $data->name,
2260                  'description'    => $data->description,
2261                  'timecreated'    => $this->apply_date_offset($data->timecreated),
2262                  'timemodified'   => $this->apply_date_offset($data->timemodified),
2263                  'usercreated'    => $data->usercreated,
2264                  'usermodified'   => $data->usermodified,
2265                  'issuername'     => $data->issuername,
2266                  'issuerurl'      => $data->issuerurl,
2267                  'issuercontact'  => $data->issuercontact,
2268                  'expiredate'     => $this->apply_date_offset($data->expiredate),
2269                  'expireperiod'   => $data->expireperiod,
2270                  'type'           => BADGE_TYPE_COURSE,
2271                  'courseid'       => $courseid,
2272                  'message'        => $data->message,
2273                  'messagesubject' => $data->messagesubject,
2274                  'attachment'     => $data->attachment,
2275                  'notification'   => $data->notification,
2276                  'status'         => BADGE_STATUS_INACTIVE,
2277                  'nextcron'       => $this->apply_date_offset($data->nextcron)
2278          );
2279  
2280          $newid = $DB->insert_record('badge', $params);
2281          $this->set_mapping('badge', $data->id, $newid, $restorefiles);
2282      }
2283  
2284      public function process_criterion($data) {
2285          global $DB;
2286  
2287          $data = (object)$data;
2288  
2289          $params = array(
2290                  'badgeid'           => $this->get_new_parentid('badge'),
2291                  'criteriatype'      => $data->criteriatype,
2292                  'method'            => $data->method,
2293                  'description'       => isset($data->description) ? $data->description : '',
2294                  'descriptionformat' => isset($data->descriptionformat) ? $data->descriptionformat : 0,
2295          );
2296          $newid = $DB->insert_record('badge_criteria', $params);
2297          $this->set_mapping('criterion', $data->id, $newid);
2298      }
2299  
2300      public function process_parameter($data) {
2301          global $DB, $CFG;
2302  
2303          require_once($CFG->libdir . '/badgeslib.php');
2304  
2305          $data = (object)$data;
2306          $criteriaid = $this->get_new_parentid('criterion');
2307  
2308          // Parameter array that will go to database.
2309          $params = array();
2310          $params['critid'] = $criteriaid;
2311  
2312          $oldparam = explode('_', $data->name);
2313  
2314          if ($data->criteriatype == BADGE_CRITERIA_TYPE_ACTIVITY) {
2315              $module = $this->get_mappingid('course_module', $oldparam[1]);
2316              $params['name'] = $oldparam[0] . '_' . $module;
2317              $params['value'] = $oldparam[0] == 'module' ? $module : $data->value;
2318          } else if ($data->criteriatype == BADGE_CRITERIA_TYPE_COURSE) {
2319              $params['name'] = $oldparam[0] . '_' . $this->get_courseid();
2320              $params['value'] = $oldparam[0] == 'course' ? $this->get_courseid() : $data->value;
2321          } else if ($data->criteriatype == BADGE_CRITERIA_TYPE_MANUAL) {
2322              $role = $this->get_mappingid('role', $data->value);
2323              if (!empty($role)) {
2324                  $params['name'] = 'role_' . $role;
2325                  $params['value'] = $role;
2326              } else {
2327                  return;
2328              }
2329          }
2330  
2331          if (!$DB->record_exists('badge_criteria_param', $params)) {
2332              $DB->insert_record('badge_criteria_param', $params);
2333          }
2334      }
2335  
2336      public function process_manual_award($data) {
2337          global $DB;
2338  
2339          $data = (object)$data;
2340          $role = $this->get_mappingid('role', $data->issuerrole);
2341  
2342          if (!empty($role)) {
2343              $award = array(
2344                  'badgeid'     => $this->get_new_parentid('badge'),
2345                  'recipientid' => $this->get_mappingid('user', $data->recipientid),
2346                  'issuerid'    => $this->get_mappingid('user', $data->issuerid),
2347                  'issuerrole'  => $role,
2348                  'datemet'     => $this->apply_date_offset($data->datemet)
2349              );
2350  
2351              // Skip the manual award if recipient or issuer can not be mapped to.
2352              if (empty($award['recipientid']) || empty($award['issuerid'])) {
2353                  return;
2354              }
2355  
2356              $DB->insert_record('badge_manual_award', $award);
2357          }
2358      }
2359  
2360      protected function after_execute() {
2361          // Add related files.
2362          $this->add_related_files('badges', 'badgeimage', 'badge');
2363      }
2364  }

2366  /**
2367   * This structure steps restores the calendar events
2368   */
2369  class restore_calendarevents_structure_step extends restore_structure_step {
2370  
2371      protected function define_structure() {
2372  
2373          $paths = array();
2374  
2375          $paths[] = new restore_path_element('calendarevents', '/events/event');
2376  
2377          return $paths;
2378      }
2379  
2380      public function process_calendarevents($data) {
2381          global $DB, $SITE, $USER;
2382  
2383          $data = (object)$data;
2384          $oldid = $data->id;
2385          $restorefiles = true; // We'll restore the files
2386          // Find the userid and the groupid associated with the event.
2387          $data->userid = $this->get_mappingid('user', $data->userid);
2388          if ($data->userid === false) {
2389              // Blank user ID means that we are dealing with module generated events such as quiz starting times.
2390              // Use the current user ID for these events.
2391              $data->userid = $USER->id;
2392          }
2393          if (!empty($data->groupid)) {
2394              $data->groupid = $this->get_mappingid('group', $data->groupid);
2395              if ($data->groupid === false) {
2396                  return;
2397              }
2398          }
2399          // Handle events with empty eventtype //MDL-32827
2400          if(empty($data->eventtype)) {
2401              if ($data->courseid == $SITE->id) {                                // Site event
2402                  $data->eventtype = "site";
2403              } else if ($data->courseid != 0 && $data->groupid == 0 && ($data->modulename == 'assignment' || $data->modulename == 'assign')) {
2404                  // Course assingment event
2405                  $data->eventtype = "due";
2406              } else if ($data->courseid != 0 && $data->groupid == 0) {      // Course event
2407                  $data->eventtype = "course";
2408              } else if ($data->groupid) {                                      // Group event
2409                  $data->eventtype = "group";
2410              } else if ($data->userid) {                                       // User event
2411                  $data->eventtype = "user";
2412              } else {
2413                  return;
2414              }
2415          }
2416  
2417          $params = array(
2418                  'name'           => $data->name,
2419                  'description'    => $data->description,
2420                  'format'         => $data->format,
2421                  'courseid'       => $this->get_courseid(),
2422                  'groupid'        => $data->groupid,
2423                  'userid'         => $data->userid,
2424                  'repeatid'       => $data->repeatid,
2425                  'modulename'     => $data->modulename,
2426                  'eventtype'      => $data->eventtype,
2427                  'timestart'      => $this->apply_date_offset($data->timestart),
2428                  'timeduration'   => $data->timeduration,
2429                  'visible'        => $data->visible,
2430                  'uuid'           => $data->uuid,
2431                  'sequence'       => $data->sequence,
2432                  'timemodified'    => $this->apply_date_offset($data->timemodified));
2433          if ($this->name == 'activity_calendar') {
2434              $params['instance'] = $this->task->get_activityid();
2435          } else {
2436              $params['instance'] = 0;
2437          }
2438          $sql = "SELECT id
2439                    FROM {event}
2440                   WHERE " . $DB->sql_compare_text('name', 255) . " = " . $DB->sql_compare_text('?', 255) . "
2441                     AND courseid = ?
2442                     AND repeatid = ?
2443                     AND modulename = ?
2444                     AND timestart = ?
2445                     AND timeduration = ?
2446                     AND " . $DB->sql_compare_text('description', 255) . " = " . $DB->sql_compare_text('?', 255);
2447          $arg = array ($params['name'], $params['courseid'], $params['repeatid'], $params['modulename'], $params['timestart'], $params['timeduration'], $params['description']);
2448          $result = $DB->record_exists_sql($sql, $arg);
2449          if (empty($result)) {
2450              $newitemid = $DB->insert_record('event', $params);
2451              $this->set_mapping('event', $oldid, $newitemid);
2452              $this->set_mapping('event_description', $oldid, $newitemid, $restorefiles);
2453          }
2454  
2455      }
2456      protected function after_execute() {
2457          // Add related files
2458          $this->add_related_files('calendar', 'event_description', 'event_description');
2459      }
2460  }
2461  
2462  class restore_course_completion_structure_step extends restore_structure_step {
2463  
2464      /**
2465       * Conditionally decide if this step should be executed.
2466       *
2467       * This function checks parameters that are not immediate settings to ensure
2468       * that the enviroment is suitable for the restore of course completion info.
2469       *
2470       * This function checks the following four parameters:
2471       *
2472       *   1. Course completion is enabled on the site
2473       *   2. The backup includes course completion information
2474       *   3. All modules are restorable
2475       *   4. All modules are marked for restore.
2476       *   5. No completion criteria already exist for the course.
2477       *
2478       * @return bool True is safe to execute, false otherwise
2479       */
2480      protected function execute_condition() {
2481          global $CFG, $DB;
2482  
2483          // First check course completion is enabled on this site
2484          if (empty($CFG->enablecompletion)) {
2485              // Disabled, don't restore course completion
2486              return false;
2487          }
2488  
2489          // No course completion on the front page.
2490          if ($this->get_courseid() == SITEID) {
2491              return false;
2492          }
2493  
2494          // Check it is included in the backup
2495          $fullpath = $this->task->get_taskbasepath();
2496          $fullpath = rtrim($fullpath, '/') . '/' . $this->filename;
2497          if (!file_exists($fullpath)) {
2498              // Not found, can't restore course completion
2499              return false;
2500          }
2501  
2502          // Check we are able to restore all backed up modules
2503          if ($this->task->is_missing_modules()) {
2504              return false;
2505          }
2506  
2507          // Check all modules within the backup are being restored.
2508          if ($this->task->is_excluding_activities()) {
2509              return false;
2510          }
2511  
2512          // Check that no completion criteria is already set for the course.
2513          if ($DB->record_exists('course_completion_criteria', array('course' => $this->get_courseid()))) {
2514              return false;
2515          }
2516  
2517          return true;
2518      }
2519  
2520      /**
2521       * Define the course completion structure
2522       *
2523       * @return array Array of restore_path_element
2524       */
2525      protected function define_structure() {
2526  
2527          // To know if we are including user completion info
2528          $userinfo = $this->get_setting_value('userscompletion');
2529  
2530          $paths = array();
2531          $paths[] = new restore_path_element('course_completion_criteria', '/course_completion/course_completion_criteria');
2532          $paths[] = new restore_path_element('course_completion_aggr_methd', '/course_completion/course_completion_aggr_methd');
2533  
2534          if ($userinfo) {
2535              $paths[] = new restore_path_element('course_completion_crit_compl', '/course_completion/course_completion_criteria/course_completion_crit_completions/course_completion_crit_compl');
2536              $paths[] = new restore_path_element('course_completions', '/course_completion/course_completions');
2537          }
2538  
2539          return $paths;
2540  
2541      }
2542  
2543      /**
2544       * Process course completion criteria
2545       *
2546       * @global moodle_database $DB
2547       * @param stdClass $data
2548       */
2549      public function process_course_completion_criteria($data) {
2550          global $DB;
2551  
2552          $data = (object)$data;
2553          $data->course = $this->get_courseid();
2554  
2555          // Apply the date offset to the time end field
2556          $data->timeend = $this->apply_date_offset($data->timeend);
2557  
2558          // Map the role from the criteria
2559          if (isset($data->role) && $data->role != '') {
2560              // Newer backups should include roleshortname, which makes this much easier.
2561              if (!empty($data->roleshortname)) {
2562                  $roleinstanceid = $DB->get_field('role', 'id', array('shortname' => $data->roleshortname));
2563                  if (!$roleinstanceid) {
2564                      $this->log(
2565                          'Could not match the role shortname in course_completion_criteria, so skipping',
2566                          backup::LOG_DEBUG
2567                      );
2568                      return;
2569                  }
2570                  $data->role = $roleinstanceid;
2571              } else {
2572                  $data->role = $this->get_mappingid('role', $data->role);
2573              }
2574  
2575              // Check we have an id, otherwise it causes all sorts of bugs.
2576              if (!$data->role) {
2577                  $this->log(
2578                      'Could not match role in course_completion_criteria, so skipping',
2579                      backup::LOG_DEBUG
2580                  );
2581                  return;
2582              }
2583          }
2584  
2585          // If the completion criteria is for a module we need to map the module instance
2586          // to the new module id.
2587          if (!empty($data->moduleinstance) && !empty($data->module)) {
2588              $data->moduleinstance = $this->get_mappingid('course_module', $data->moduleinstance);
2589              if (empty($data->moduleinstance)) {
2590                  $this->log(
2591                      'Could not match the module instance in course_completion_criteria, so skipping',
2592                      backup::LOG_DEBUG
2593                  );
2594                  return;
2595              }
2596          } else {
2597              $data->module = null;
2598              $data->moduleinstance = null;
2599          }
2600  
2601          // We backup the course shortname rather than the ID so that we can match back to the course
2602          if (!empty($data->courseinstanceshortname)) {
2603              $courseinstanceid = $DB->get_field('course', 'id', array('shortname'=>$data->courseinstanceshortname));
2604              if (!$courseinstanceid) {
2605                  $this->log(
2606                      'Could not match the course instance in course_completion_criteria, so skipping',
2607                      backup::LOG_DEBUG
2608                  );
2609                  return;
2610              }
2611          } else {
2612              $courseinstanceid = null;
2613          }
2614          $data->courseinstance = $courseinstanceid;
2615  
2616          $params = array(
2617              'course'         => $data->course,
2618              'criteriatype'   => $data->criteriatype,
2619              'enrolperiod'    => $data->enrolperiod,
2620              'courseinstance' => $data->courseinstance,
2621              'module'         => $data->module,
2622              'moduleinstance' => $data->moduleinstance,
2623              'timeend'        => $data->timeend,
2624              'gradepass'      => $data->gradepass,
2625              'role'           => $data->role
2626          );
2627          $newid = $DB->insert_record('course_completion_criteria', $params);
2628          $this->set_mapping('course_completion_criteria', $data->id, $newid);
2629      }
2630  
2631      /**
2632       * Processes course compltion criteria complete records
2633       *
2634       * @global moodle_database $DB
2635       * @param stdClass $data
2636       */
2637      public function process_course_completion_crit_compl($data) {
2638          global $DB;
2639  
2640          $data = (object)$data;
2641  
2642          // This may be empty if criteria could not be restored
2643          $data->criteriaid = $this->get_mappingid('course_completion_criteria', $data->criteriaid);
2644  
2645          $data->course = $this->get_courseid();
2646          $data->userid = $this->get_mappingid('user', $data->userid);
2647  
2648          if (!empty($data->criteriaid) && !empty($data->userid)) {
2649              $params = array(
2650                  'userid' => $data->userid,
2651                  'course' => $data->course,
2652                  'criteriaid' => $data->criteriaid,
2653                  'timecompleted' => $this->apply_date_offset($data->timecompleted)
2654              );
2655              if (isset($data->gradefinal)) {
2656                  $params['gradefinal'] = $data->gradefinal;
2657              }
2658              if (isset($data->unenroled)) {
2659                  $params['unenroled'] = $data->unenroled;
2660              }
2661              $DB->insert_record('course_completion_crit_compl', $params);
2662          }
2663      }
2664  
2665      /**
2666       * Process course completions
2667       *
2668       * @global moodle_database $DB
2669       * @param stdClass $data
2670       */
2671      public function process_course_completions($data) {
2672          global $DB;
2673  
2674          $data = (object)$data;
2675  
2676          $data->course = $this->get_courseid();
2677          $data->userid = $this->get_mappingid('user', $data->userid);
2678  
2679          if (!empty($data->userid)) {
2680              $params = array(
2681                  'userid' => $data->userid,
2682                  'course' => $data->course,
2683                  'timeenrolled' => $this->apply_date_offset($data->timeenrolled),
2684                  'timestarted' => $this->apply_date_offset($data->timestarted),
2685                  'timecompleted' => $this->apply_date_offset($data->timecompleted),
2686                  'reaggregate' => $data->reaggregate
2687              );
2688  
2689              $existing = $DB->get_record('course_completions', array(
2690                  'userid' => $data->userid,
2691                  'course' => $data->course
2692              ));
2693  
2694              // MDL-46651 - If cron writes out a new record before we get to it
2695              // then we should replace it with the Truth data from the backup.
2696              // This may be obsolete after MDL-48518 is resolved
2697              if ($existing) {
2698                  $params['id'] = $existing->id;
2699                  $DB->update_record('course_completions', $params);
2700              } else {
2701                  $DB->insert_record('course_completions', $params);
2702              }
2703          }
2704      }

2736  /**
2737   * This structure step restores course logs (cmid = 0), delegating
2738   * the hard work to the corresponding {@link restore_logs_processor} passing the
2739   * collection of {@link restore_log_rule} rules to be observed as they are defined
2740   * by the task. Note this is only executed based in the 'logs' setting.
2741   *
2742   * NOTE: This is executed by final task, to have all the activities already restored
2743   *
2744   * NOTE: Not all course logs are being restored. For now only 'course' and 'user'
2745   * records are. There are others like 'calendar' and 'upload' that will be handled
2746   * later.
2747   *
2748   * NOTE: All the missing actions (not able to be restored) are sent to logs for
2749   * debugging purposes
2750   */
2751  class restore_course_logs_structure_step extends restore_structure_step {
2752  
2753      /**
2754       * Conditionally decide if this step should be executed.
2755       *
2756       * This function checks the following parameter:
2757       *
2758       *   1. the course/logs.xml file exists
2759       *
2760       * @return bool true is safe to execute, false otherwise
2761       */
2762      protected function execute_condition() {
2763  
2764          // Check it is included in the backup
2765          $fullpath = $this->task->get_taskbasepath();
2766          $fullpath = rtrim($fullpath, '/') . '/' . $this->filename;
2767          if (!file_exists($fullpath)) {
2768              // Not found, can't restore course logs
2769              return false;
2770          }
2771  
2772          return true;
2773      }
2774  
2775      protected function define_structure() {
2776  
2777          $paths = array();
2778  
2779          // Simple, one plain level of information contains them
2780          $paths[] = new restore_path_element('log', '/logs/log');
2781  
2782          return $paths;
2783      }
2784  
2785      protected function process_log($data) {
2786          global $DB;
2787  
2788          $data = (object)($data);
2789  
2790          $data->time = $this->apply_date_offset($data->time);
2791          $data->userid = $this->get_mappingid('user', $data->userid);
2792          $data->course = $this->get_courseid();
2793          $data->cmid = 0;
2794  
2795          // For any reason user wasn't remapped ok, stop processing this
2796          if (empty($data->userid)) {
2797              return;
2798          }
2799  
2800          // Everything ready, let's delegate to the restore_logs_processor
2801  
2802          // Set some fixed values that will save tons of DB requests
2803          $values = array(
2804              'course' => $this->get_courseid());
2805          // Get instance and process log record
2806          $data = restore_logs_processor::get_instance($this->task, $values)->process_log_record($data);
2807  
2808          // If we have data, insert it, else something went wrong in the restore_logs_processor
2809          if ($data) {
2810              if (empty($data->url)) {
2811                  $data->url = '';
2812              }
2813              if (empty($data->info)) {
2814                  $data->info = '';
2815              }
2816              // Store the data in the legacy log table if we are still using it.
2817              $manager = get_log_manager();
2818              if (method_exists($manager, 'legacy_add_to_log')) {
2819                  $manager->legacy_add_to_log($data->course, $data->module, $data->action, $data->url,
2820                      $data->info, $data->cmid, $data->userid, $data->ip, $data->time);
2821              }
2822          }
2823      }
2824  }

2826  /**
2827   * This structure step restores activity logs, extending {@link restore_course_logs_structure_step}
2828   * sharing its same structure but modifying the way records are handled
2829   */
2830  class restore_activity_logs_structure_step extends restore_course_logs_structure_step {
2831  
2832      protected function process_log($data) {
2833          global $DB;
2834  
2835          $data = (object)($data);
2836  
2837          $data->time = $this->apply_date_offset($data->time);
2838          $data->userid = $this->get_mappingid('user', $data->userid);
2839          $data->course = $this->get_courseid();
2840          $data->cmid = $this->task->get_moduleid();
2841  
2842          // For any reason user wasn't remapped ok, stop processing this
2843          if (empty($data->userid)) {
2844              return;
2845          }
2846  
2847          // Everything ready, let's delegate to the restore_logs_processor
2848  
2849          // Set some fixed values that will save tons of DB requests
2850          $values = array(
2851              'course' => $this->get_courseid(),
2852              'course_module' => $this->task->get_moduleid(),
2853              $this->task->get_modulename() => $this->task->get_activityid());
2854          // Get instance and process log record
2855          $data = restore_logs_processor::get_instance($this->task, $values)->process_log_record($data);
2856  
2857          // If we have data, insert it, else something went wrong in the restore_logs_processor
2858          if ($data) {
2859              if (empty($data->url)) {
2860                  $data->url = '';
2861              }
2862              if (empty($data->info)) {
2863                  $data->info = '';
2864              }
2865              // Store the data in the legacy log table if we are still using it.
2866              $manager = get_log_manager();
2867              if (method_exists($manager, 'legacy_add_to_log')) {
2868                  $manager->legacy_add_to_log($data->course, $data->module, $data->action, $data->url,
2869                      $data->info, $data->cmid, $data->userid, $data->ip, $data->time);
2870              }
2871          }
2872      }

2876  /**
2877   * Defines the restore step for advanced grading methods attached to the activity module
2878   */
2879  class restore_activity_grading_structure_step extends restore_structure_step {
2880  
2881      /**
2882       * This step is executed only if the grading file is present
2883       */
2884       protected function execute_condition() {
2885  
2886          if ($this->get_courseid() == SITEID) {
2887              return false;
2888          }
2889  
2890          $fullpath = $this->task->get_taskbasepath();
2891          $fullpath = rtrim($fullpath, '/') . '/' . $this->filename;
2892          if (!file_exists($fullpath)) {
2893              return false;
2894          }
2895  
2896          return true;
2897      }

3015  /**
3016   * This structure step restores the grade items associated with one activity
3017   * All the grade items are made child of the "course" grade item but the original
3018   * categoryid is saved as parentitemid in the backup_ids table, so, when restoring
3019   * the complete gradebook (categories and calculations), that information is
3020   * available there
3021   */
3022  class restore_activity_grades_structure_step extends restore_structure_step {
3023  
3024      /**
3025       * No grades in front page.
3026       * @return bool
3027       */
3028      protected function execute_condition() {
3029          return ($this->get_courseid() != SITEID);
3030      }
3031  
3032      protected function define_structure() {
3033  
3034          $paths = array();
3035          $userinfo = $this->get_setting_value('userinfo');
3036  
3037          $paths[] = new restore_path_element('grade_item', '/activity_gradebook/grade_items/grade_item');
3038          $paths[] = new restore_path_element('grade_letter', '/activity_gradebook/grade_letters/grade_letter');
3039          if ($userinfo) {
3040              $paths[] = new restore_path_element('grade_grade',
3041                             '/activity_gradebook/grade_items/grade_item/grade_grades/grade_grade');
3042          }
3043          return $paths;
3044      }
3045  
3046      protected function process_grade_item($data) {
3047          global $DB;
3048  
3049          $data = (object)($data);
3050          $oldid       = $data->id;        // We'll need these later
3051          $oldparentid = $data->categoryid;
3052          $courseid = $this->get_courseid();
3053  
3054          $idnumber = null;
3055          if (!empty($data->idnumber)) {
3056              // Don't get any idnumber from course module. Keep them as they are in grade_item->idnumber
3057              // Reason: it's not clear what happens with outcomes->idnumber or activities with multiple items (workshop)
3058              // so the best is to keep the ones already in the gradebook
3059              // Potential problem: duplicates if same items are restored more than once. :-(
3060              // This needs to be fixed in some way (outcomes & activities with multiple items)
3061              // $data->idnumber     = get_coursemodule_from_instance($data->itemmodule, $data->iteminstance)->idnumber;
3062              // In any case, verify always for uniqueness
3063              $sql = "SELECT cm.id
3064                        FROM {course_modules} cm
3065                       WHERE cm.course = :courseid AND
3066                             cm.idnumber = :idnumber AND
3067                             cm.id <> :cmid";
3068              $params = array(
3069                  'courseid' => $courseid,
3070                  'idnumber' => $data->idnumber,
3071                  'cmid' => $this->task->get_moduleid()
3072              );
3073              if (!$DB->record_exists_sql($sql, $params) && !$DB->record_exists('grade_items', array('courseid' => $courseid, 'idnumber' => $data->idnumber))) {
3074                  $idnumber = $data->idnumber;
3075              }
3076          }
3077  
3078          if (!empty($data->categoryid)) {
3079              // If the grade category id of the grade item being restored belongs to this course
3080              // then it is a fair assumption that this is the correct grade category for the activity
3081              // and we should leave it in place, if not then unset it.
3082              // TODO MDL-34790 Gradebook does not import if target course has gradebook categories.
3083              $conditions = array('id' => $data->categoryid, 'courseid' => $courseid);
3084              if (!$this->task->is_samesite() || !$DB->record_exists('grade_categories', $conditions)) {
3085                  unset($data->categoryid);
3086              }
3087          }
3088  
3089          unset($data->id);
3090          $data->courseid     = $this->get_courseid();
3091          $data->iteminstance = $this->task->get_activityid();
3092          $data->idnumber     = $idnumber;
3093          $data->scaleid      = $this->get_mappingid('scale', $data->scaleid);
3094          $data->outcomeid    = $this->get_mappingid('outcome', $data->outcomeid);
3095          $data->timecreated  = $this->apply_date_offset($data->timecreated);
3096          $data->timemodified = $this->apply_date_offset($data->timemodified);
3097  
3098          $gradeitem = new grade_item($data, false);
3099          $gradeitem->insert('restore');
3100  
3101          //sortorder is automatically assigned when inserting. Re-instate the previous sortorder
3102          $gradeitem->sortorder = $data->sortorder;
3103          $gradeitem->update('restore');
3104  
3105          // Set mapping, saving the original category id into parentitemid
3106          // gradebook restore (final task) will need it to reorganise items
3107          $this->set_mapping('grade_item', $oldid, $gradeitem->id, false, null, $oldparentid);
3108      }
3109  
3110      protected function process_grade_grade($data) {
3111          $data = (object)($data);
3112          $olduserid = $data->userid;
3113          $oldid = $data->id;
3114          unset($data->id);
3115  
3116          $data->itemid = $this->get_new_parentid('grade_item');
3117  
3118          $data->userid = $this->get_mappingid('user', $data->userid, null);
3119          if (!empty($data->userid)) {
3120              $data->usermodified = $this->get_mappingid('user', $data->usermodified, null);
3121              $data->rawscaleid = $this->get_mappingid('scale', $data->rawscaleid);
3122              // TODO: Ask, all the rest of locktime/exported... work with time... to be rolled?
3123              $data->overridden = $this->apply_date_offset($data->overridden);
3124  
3125              $grade = new grade_grade($data, false);
3126              $grade->insert('restore');
3127              $this->set_mapping('grade_grades', $oldid, $grade->id);
3128          } else {
3129              debugging("Mapped user id not found for user id '{$olduserid}', grade item id '{$data->itemid}'");
3130          }
3131      }
3132  
3133      /**
3134       * process activity grade_letters. Note that, while these are possible,
3135       * because grade_letters are contextid based, in practice, only course
3136       * context letters can be defined. So we keep here this method knowing
3137       * it won't be executed ever. gradebook restore will restore course letters.
3138       */
3139      protected function process_grade_letter($data) {
3140          global $DB;
3141  
3142          $data['contextid'] = $this->task->get_contextid();
3143          $gradeletter = (object)$data;
3144  
3145          // Check if it exists before adding it
3146          unset($data['id']);
3147          if (!$DB->record_exists('grade_letters', $data)) {
3148              $newitemid = $DB->insert_record('grade_letters', $gradeletter);
3149          }

3151      }

3160  /**
3161   * Step in charge of restoring the grade history of an activity.
3162   *
3163   * This step is added to the task regardless of the setting 'grade_histories'.
3164   * The reason is to allow for a more flexible step in case the logic needs to be
3165   * split accross different settings to control the history of items and/or grades.

3167  class restore_activity_grade_history_structure_step extends restore_structure_step {

3169      /**
3170       * This step is executed only if the grade history file is present.

3174          if ($this->get_courseid() == SITEID) {
3175              return false;
3176          }
3177  
3178          $fullpath = $this->task->get_taskbasepath();
3179          $fullpath = rtrim($fullpath, '/') . '/' . $this->filename;
3180          if (!file_exists($fullpath)) {
3181              return false;
3182          }
3183          return true;
3184      }
3185  
3186      protected function define_structure() {
3187          $paths = array();

3194              $paths[] = new restore_path_element('grade_grade',
3195                 '/grade_history/grade_grades/grade_grade');
3196          }

3199      }
3200  
3201      protected function process_grade_grade($data) {

3218              $this->log($message, backup::LOG_DEBUG);
3219          }
